title: FWSAkRDRtools Tutorial
text: installed ‘FWSAkRDRtools’ previously want update latest version, may need uninstall package first. Occasionally R hits roadblock needs manually remove package can proceed.
code: remove.packages("FWSAkRDRtools") .rs.restartR()

title: FWSAkRDRtools Tutorial
text: Install development version ‘FWSAkRDRtools’ GitHub. R package ‘remotes’ (demonstrated ) ‘devtools’ required install packages GitHub.
code: if (!require("remotes")) install.packages("remotes")  Sys.setenv(R_REMOTES_STANDALONE="true") remotes::install_github("hdvincelette/FWSAkRDRtools")

title: FWSAkRDRtools Tutorial
text: Run following housekeeping code set chunk behavior within document. Load ‘FWSAkRDRtools’ R library set working directory (like files saved /copied ). Run following access information ‘FWSAkRDRtools’ Help pane, including documentation pages function. useful quick reference function usage, arguments, expected output.
code: options(width = 9999)  knitr::opts_chunk$set(   echo = TRUE,   collapse = TRUE,   comment = "#>",   error=TRUE ) library(FWSAkRDRtools)  wd<- "C:/Users/hvincelette/OneDrive - DOI/Documents/Data_management/Test" help(package = "FWSAkRDRtools")

what: get.dir.template(): get the directory tree template
title: FWSAkRDRtools Tutorial
text: function establishes new directory using standardized RDR project folder structure: get.dir.template() can help organize local project archived RDR. project name (project) unrestricted, prompt requests approval overwrite existing folder name local path. local path (local.path) new directory created. default, main project folders included (main = TRUE & incoming = FALSE) . Normally, data stewards write permission ‘incoming’ folder RDR project, data managers write modify permissions folders. helps ensure files accidentally overwritten /lost. Use incoming = TRUE include “incoming” folder new directory.
code: -- admin -- changelog.txt -- code -- data    |__final_data    |__raw_data -- documents    |__posters    |__protocols    |__publications    |__reports    |__talks -- incoming -- metadata get.dir.template(   project = "mbmlb_909_Eskimo_Curlew_study",   local.path = wd,   main = TRUE,   incoming = FALSE )

title: FWSAkRDRtools Tutorial
text: find.projects() queries RDR existing project folder names. Pattern(s) (pattern) can character string vector search term(s). default pattern = NULL, returns results project folders. Patterns must formatted “regular expressions”, spaces within string (e.g., “red knot”) automatically replaced “.*?” (e.g., “red.*?knot”) improve search results. Patterns case-sensitive. Print ?base::regex view regular expressions R documentation. program code (program) optional argument fine-tune search results within RDR program folders (fes, mbm, nwrs, osm, sa). output either full folder path (full.path = TRUE) just project folder name(s) (full.path = FALSE).
code: ?base::regex  project.folders <- find.projects(   pattern = c("red.*knot", "alaska"),   program = "mbm",   full.path = FALSE )

title: FWSAkRDRtools Tutorial
text: find.files() allows query specific RDR project folder individual files. Pattern(s) (pattern) can character string vector search term(s). default pattern = NULL, returns results files. Patterns must formatted “regular expressions”, spaces within string (e.g., “data dictionary”) automatically replaced “.*?” (e.g., “data.*?dictionary”) improve search results. Patterns case-sensitive. Print ?base::regex view regular expressions R documentation. project name pattern (project) required. pattern provided one project found, menu ask selection. can specify subfolder path (subfolder.path) fine-tune search results (.e., search “metadata” subfolder file name containing “dictionary”). search can restricted top level specified subfolder path (recursive = FALSE). Otherwise, function search subsequent subfolders (recursive = TRUE). search include main (main = TRUE) “incoming” (incoming = TRUE) folders unless one excluded changing argument FALSE. output either full file path (full.path = TRUE) just subfolder path(s) file name(s) (full.path = FALSE).
code: ?base::regex  file.locs <- find.files(   pattern = c("template", "dictionary", "\\.csv", "hello"),   project = "mbmlb_010_Grey_headed_chickadee_hybridization",   subfolder.path = "metadata",   main = TRUE,   incoming = FALSE,   recursive = TRUE,   full.path = FALSE )

title: FWSAkRDRtools Tutorial
text: download.files() enables download files specified RDR project folder onto local drive. Arguments download.files() operate way find.files(), additions. local path (local.path) files saved. download.file.method method downloading files. default ("auto") chooses appropriate method operating system, method may need specified download fails (e.g., "internal", "libcurl", "wget", "curl", "wininet"). Print ?download.file details download file methods. Print browseURL(wd) view downloaded files.
code: ?download.file  download.files(   pattern = c("banding", "dictionary"),   project = "mbmlb_010_Grey_headed_chickadee_hybridization",   subfolder.path = "",   local.path = wd,   main = TRUE,   incoming = FALSE,   recursive = TRUE,   download.file.method = "auto" )  browseURL(wd)

what: read.tables(): read RDR project tables into R
title: FWSAkRDRtools Tutorial
text: read.tables() enables read tabular data files specified RDR project folder directly R. Arguments read.tables() operate way find.files(), additions. read.tables() currently reads XLS/XLSX (via readxl::read_excel) CSV (via utils::read.csv) table formats. na.strings strings interpreted NA values. header indicates whether first line contains variable names. header applies CSV formats, default TRUE. read.tables() used cautiously arguments dependent functions set default values. Tables reviewed errors re-imported needed using file URLs printed output. read.tables() return data frame one file selected list data frames multiple files selected.
code: df <- read.tables(   pattern = c("dictionary"),   project = "mbmlb_010_Grey_headed_chickadee_hybridization",   subfolder.path = "metadata",   main = TRUE,   incoming = FALSE,   recursive = TRUE,   header = TRUE,   na.strings = "" )  df.list <- read.tables(   pattern = c("\\.csv", "\\.xlsx"),   project = "mbmlb_010_Grey_headed_chickadee_hybridization",   subfolder.path = "",   main = TRUE,   incoming = FALSE,   recursive = TRUE,   header = TRUE,   na.strings = "" )

title: FWSAkRDRtools Tutorial
code: clone.project(   project = "mbmlb_010_Grey_headed_chickadee_hybridization",   local.path = wd,   main = TRUE,   incoming = TRUE   )

what: summarize.files(): summarize files in an RDR project
title: FWSAkRDRtools Tutorial
code: file.summary<- summarize.files(   project = "mbmlb_010_Grey_headed_chickadee_hybridization",   subfolder = "",   main = TRUE,   incoming = TRUE,   recursive = TRUE )

what: commit.files(): commit files to an RDR project
title: FWSAkRDRtools Tutorial
code: # Note files will only be committed if you are the data steward of the project. Refer to the Data Manager to understand your project roles.  commit.summary<- commit.files(   project = "mbmlb_010_Grey_headed_chickadee_hybridization",   local.path = paste0(wd,"/mbmlb_010_Grey_headed_chickadee_hybridization"),   recursive = TRUE   )

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hannah Vincelette. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Vincelette H (2024). FWSAkRDRtools: File Management Tools Fish & Wildlife Service Alaska Regional Data Repository. R package version 0.1.0, https://hdvincelette.github.io/FWSAkRDRtools/, https://github.com/hdvincelette/FWSAkRDRtools.
code: @Manual{,   title = {FWSAkRDRtools: File Management Tools for the Fish & Wildlife Service Alaska Regional Data Repository},   author = {Hannah Vincelette},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0,   https://hdvincelette.github.io/FWSAkRDRtools/},   url = {https://github.com/hdvincelette/FWSAkRDRtools}, }

what: Clone a project from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — clone.project
title: Clone a project from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — clone.project
text: Creates copy RDR project folder specified location. Remote users must connected one Service’s approved remote connection technologies, Virtual Private Network (VPN).

title: Clone a project from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — clone.project
code: clone.project(project, local.path, main, incoming)

title: Clone a project from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — clone.project
text: project Character string. Name project folder. local.path Character string. Directory path cloned project located. Default working directory, getwd(). main Logical. Whether return results main project subfolders (subfolders except "incoming"). Default TRUE. incoming Logical. Whether return results "incoming" project subfolder. Default TRUE.

title: Clone a project from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — clone.project
text: Returns download project folder contents.

title: Clone a project from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — clone.project
code: # clone.project(project = "mbmlb_010_Grey_headed_chickadee_hybridization", local.path = getwd(), main = TRUE, incoming = TRUE)

title: Commit files to the
text: Copies local file(s) "incoming" subfolder specified RDR project updates changelog document changes. Remote users must connected Service’s approved remote connection technologies, Virtual Private Network (VPN) granted write permission project’s “incoming" subfolder (.e., authorized "data steward").

title: Commit files to the
code: commit.files(project, local.path, recursive, review.duplicate, rdr.overwrite)

title: Commit files to the
text: project Character string. Name project folder. local.path Character string. Directory name path uncommitted files located. Default working directory, getwd(). recursive Logical. Whether search commit files subdirectories. Default TRUE. review.duplicate Logical. Whether review local duplicate files (identical file name extension, different subfolder path). Default TRUE, duplicate files reviewed selected individually. FALSE, files automatically selected commit. rdr.overwrite Logical. Whether overwrite RDR files (identical file name, extension, subfolder path) betweent local RDR folders. Default FALSE. TRUE, overwrites must reviewed approved individually. files "incoming" subfolder RDR may immediately overwritten, main project subfolders overwritten discretion Data Manager.

title: Commit files to the
text: Returns data frame summarizing committed files.

title: Commit files to the
code: # e.g.commit<- commit.files(project = "mbmlb_010_Grey_headed_chickadee_hybridization", local.path = getwd(), recursive = TRUE, review.duplicate = TRUE, rdr.overwrite = FALSE)

what: Download project file(s) from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — download.files
title: Download project file(s) from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — download.files
text: Searches file name patterns specified RDR project folder downloads matching files. Remote users must connected one Service’s approved remote connection technologies, Virtual Private Network (VPN).

title: Download project file(s) from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — download.files
code: download.files(   pattern,   project,   subfolder.path,   local.path,   main,   incoming,   recursive,   download.file.method )

title: Download project file(s) from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — download.files
text: pattern Character vector. File name pattern(s). Must regular expression; print ?base::regex help. Default NULL, allows selection files. project Character string. Name project folder. subfolder.path Character string. Project subfolder path. local.path Character string. Directory path downloaded files saved. Default working directory, getwd(). main Logical. Whether return results main project subfolders (subfolders except "incoming"). Default TRUE. incoming Logical. Whether return results "incoming" project subfolder. Default TRUE. recursive Logical. Whether search download files subdirectories. Default TRUE. download.file.method Character string. Method use downloading files. Print ?download.file available methods. Default "auto".

title: Download project file(s) from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — download.files
text: Returns file download(s) match search criteria.

title: Download project file(s) from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — download.files
code: # download.files(pattern = c("template","dictionary","\.csv","hello"), project = "mbmlb_007_NWR_Alaska_Landbird_Monitoring_Survey", subfolder.path = "metadata, local.path = getwd(), main = TRUE, incoming = TRUE, recursive = TRUE, download.file.method = "curl")

what: Find the location(s) of project file(s) on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.files
title: Find the location(s) of project file(s) on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.files
text: Finds data file(s) specified RDR project folder. Remote users must connected one Service’s approved remote connection technologies, Virtual Private Network (VPN).

title: Find the location(s) of project file(s) on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.files
code: find.files(   pattern,   project,   subfolder.path,   main,   incoming,   recursive,   full.path )

title: Find the location(s) of project file(s) on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.files
text: pattern Character vector. File name pattern(s). Must regular expression; print ?base::regex help. case-sensitive. Spaces automatically replaced ".*?" improve search results. Default NULL, returns results files. project Character string. Project folder name. Can partial name formatted regular expression. case-sensitive. subfolder.path Character string. Project subfolder path. main Logical. Whether return results main project subfolders (subfolders except "incoming"). Default TRUE. incoming Logical. whether return results "incoming" project subfolder. Default TRUE. recursive Logical. Whether search files subdirectories. Default TRUE. full.path Logical. Whether return full file path. Default FALSE

title: Find the location(s) of project file(s) on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.files
text: Returns vector paths files match search criteria.

title: Find the location(s) of project file(s) on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.files
code: # e.g.file.locs<- find.files(pattern = c("template","dictionary","\.csv","hello"), project = "mbmlb_007_NWR_Alaska_Landbird_Monitoring_Survey", subfolder.path = "", main = FALSE, incoming = TRUE, recursive = TRUE, full.path = FALSE)

what: Find projects on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.projects
title: Find projects on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.projects
text: Finds RDR project name(s). Remote users must connected one Service’s approved remote connection technologies, Virtual Private Network (VPN).

title: Find projects on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.projects
code: find.projects(pattern, program, full.path)

title: Find projects on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.projects
text: pattern Character vector. Project folder name pattern(s). Must regular expression; print ?base::regex help. case-sensitive. Spaces automatically replaced ".*?" improve search results. Default NULL, returns results project folders. program Optional character string. Program prefix help narrow search results. Options include "fes", "mbm", "nwrs", "osm", "sa". full.path Logical. Whether return full folder path. Default FALSE, folder name returned.

title: Find projects on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.projects
text: Returns vector paths names project folders match search criteria.

title: Find projects on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.projects
code: # e.g.project.names<- find.projects(pattern = c("red.*knot","alaska"), program = "mbm", full.path = FALSE)

what: Get the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) project directory tree template. — get.dir.template

title: Get the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) project directory tree template. — get.dir.template
code: get.dir.template(project, local.path, main = TRUE, incoming = FALSE)

title: Get the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) project directory tree template. — get.dir.template
text: project Character string. Name project folder. local.path Character string. Directory path project located. Default working directory, getwd(). main Logical. Whether include main project subfolders (subfolders except "incoming"). Default TRUE. incoming Logical. Whether include "incoming" project subfolder. Default FALSE.

title: Get the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) project directory tree template. — get.dir.template
text: Returns download project directory tree template.

title: Get the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) project directory tree template. — get.dir.template
code: # get.dir.template(project = "mbmlb_909_Eskimo_Curlew_study", local.path = getwd(), main = TRUE, incoming = TRUE)

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: See magrittr::%>% details.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
code: lhs %>% rhs

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: result calling rhs(lhs).

what: Read a tabular project file on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) into R — read.tables
title: Read a tabular project file on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) into R — read.tables
text: Reads tabular data file(s) specified RDR project folder. Currently reads xls/xlsx (via readxl::read_excel) csv (via utils::read.csv) table formats. Remote users must connected one Service’s approved remote connection technologies, Virtual Private Network (VPN).

title: Read a tabular project file on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) into R — read.tables
code: read.tables(   pattern,   project,   subfolder.path,   main,   incoming,   recursive,   header,   na.strings,   sep )

title: Read a tabular project file on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) into R — read.tables
text: pattern Character vector. File name pattern(s). Must regular expression; print ?base::regex help. Default NULL, allows selection files. project Character string. Name project folder. subfolder.path Character string. Project subfolder path. main Logical. Whether return results main project subolders (subfolders except "incoming"). Default TRUE. incoming Logical. Whether return results "incoming" project subfolder. Default TRUE. recursive Logical. Whether search read files subdirectories. Default TRUE. header Logical. Whether first line contains variable names. Default TRUE. applies csv files. na.strings Character vector. Strings interpreted NA values.

title: Read a tabular project file on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) into R — read.tables
text: Returns data frame (one file selected), list selected tabular data files.

title: Read a tabular project file on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) into R — read.tables
code: # e.g.tabular.data<- read.tables(pattern = c("\.csv","\.xlsx"), project = "mbmlb_007_NWR_Alaska_Landbird_Monitoring_Survey", subfolder.path = "", main = TRUE, incoming = TRUE, recursive = TRUE, header = TRUE, na.strings = "")

what: Summarize project files on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — summarize.files
title: Summarize project files on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — summarize.files
text: Summarizes files specified RDR project folder. Remote users must connected one Service’s approved remote connection technologies, Virtual Private Network (VPN).

title: Summarize project files on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — summarize.files
code: summarize.files(   project,   subfolder = NULL,   main = TRUE,   incoming = TRUE,   recursive = TRUE )

title: Summarize project files on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — summarize.files
text: project Character string. Name project folder. subfolder Optional character vector. Project subfolder(s) summarize. Default NULL, returns results subfolders. main Logical. Whether return results main project subfolders (subfolders except incoming). Default TRUE. incoming Logical. Whether return results "incoming" project subfolder. Default TRUE. recursive Logical. Whether search files subdirectories. Default TRUE.

title: Summarize project files on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — summarize.files
text: Returns data frame summarizing subfolder contents.

title: Summarize project files on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — summarize.files
code: # e.g.summary<- summarize.files(project = "mbmlb_007_NWR_Alaska_Landbird_Monitoring_Survey", subfolder = c("/", "final_data", "metadata"), main = FALSE, incoming = TRUE, recursive = TRUE)
